text.p: British transport group FirstBus Plc said on Tuesday the current financial year had started well.

"In the first two months the group has turned in a satisfactory trading performance although the residual effects of the disruption in central Manchester and our determination to defend our market in Strathclyde are discernible in local trading results," FirstBus said in a statement.
FirstBus said it was Britain's largest bus operator, employing 23,500 people.
In Manchester, business was disrupted by a bomb set off in June by the Irish Republican Army.

FirstBus bought Strathclyde Buses last year. That was referred to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission and the government said FirstBus would have to sell a Scottish subsidiary and one of its depots.
FirstBus said it believed there were "material" changes to the market since the MMC inquiry and said it planned to discuss these with the government.
